sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"发行，发出，发给"之意。
means: issue ： 多指通过官方或正式渠道正式发行。
distribute ： 指把东西分发给所属者或应得者。
publish ： 普通用词，多指出版发行文字作品，也指发布新闻或发表见解等。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"主题，话题"之意。
means: issue ： 指有争论、议论，急需讨论研究的热点话题。
subject ： 一般用词，使用广泛。指书籍、文章、演讲、讨论等中所隐含的、暗示的，需要由读者或听众推断的主题或中心话题。
theme ： 系正式用词，多指文学、艺术作品的主题，或论文、演说的主题。
topic ： 普通用词，含义广泛，但其范畴小于subject。既可指文章、讲话的题目，谈话的内容，又可指提纲中的标题甚至段落的主题或中心思想。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"问题"之意。
means: problem ： 指客观上存在的、难以处理或难以理解的问题。
question ： 通常指用口头或书面提出来要求回答或有待讨论解决的问题。
issue ： 多指意见能达到一致的问题，着重争论或讨论中的问题。
matter ： 含义不很具体，暗示人们考虑和关心的事和话题。

word_mean: 脓疮口：排出脓、血或其他物质的化脓性病损

sentence.Network_en: The key issue was whether the four defendants acted dishonestly.
sentence.Network_cn: 关键问题是4名被告是否存在欺诈行为。

sentence.Network_en: She avoided the issue by ordering a turkey sandwich.
sentence.Network_cn: 她点了份火鸡三明治，以此来避开这个重要问题。

sentence.Network_en: He said the issue was not a major irritant.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说那个问题不是什么大问题。

问题;主题;起因
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense outflowing): from Old French, based on Latin exitus, past participle of exire 'go out'

encyclopedia.content: 及物动词 vt. 1.发行；发布 The post office issued the stamps last week. 上星期邮局发行了这些邮票。 2.发给，配给[O][(+to)],核发 Who issued the travel documents? 谁核发这些旅游证件的？ 3.使流出，放出，排出 不及物动词 vi. 1.出来[(+forth)] 2.流出[(+from)] Lava issued from the volcano. 熔岩从火山口流出来。 3.由。..得出，由。..产生[(+from)] A strange noise issues from the next room. 隔壁房间里传出奇怪的

entry.tran: 重要问题;议题;争论的问题
entry.def: An issue is an important subject that people are arguing about or discussing.

example.ex: Agents will raise the issue of prize-money for next year's world championships...
example.tran: 经纪人将提出下年度世锦赛奖金的问题。

example.ex: A key issue for higher education in the 1990's is the need for greater diversity of courses...
example.tran: 20 世纪 90 年代,高等教育的一个重要议题是要使课程更加多样化。

entry.tran: 首要事项;要点;问题的要害
entry.def: If something is the issue, it is the thing you consider to be the most important part of a situation or discussion.

example.ex: I was earning a lot of money, but that was not the issue...
example.tran: 我赚很多钱,但那不是最重要的。

example.ex: She avoided the issue by ordering a turkey sandwich...
example.tran: 她点了份火鸡三明治,以此来避开这个重要问题。

entry.def: An issue of something such as a magazine or newspaper is the version of it that is published, for example, in a particular month or on a particular day.

example.ex: The growing problem is underlined in the latest issue of the Lancet...
example.tran: 最近一期的《柳叶刀》杂志中强调了这一日益严重的问题。

example.ex: I read Germaine Greer's article in the March issue with particular interest.
example.tran: 我饶有兴致地阅读了杰曼·格里尔在三月那期发表的文章。

entry.def: If you issue a statement or a warning, you make it known formally or publicly.

example.ex: Last night he issued a statement denying the allegations...
example.tran: 昨晚他发表声明否认那些指控。

example.ex: The government issued a warning that the strikers should end their action or face dismissal...
example.tran: 政府发布了警告,要求罢工者停止行动,否则将被解雇。

entry.def: If you are issued with something, it is officially given to you.

example.ex: On your appointment you will be issued with a written statement of particulars of employment...
example.tran: 正式任命时,你会拿到一份关于雇用细则的书面声明。

example.ex: Staff will be issued with new grey-and-yellow designer uniforms.
example.tran: 将会向雇员发放灰黄相间的名牌新制服。

entry.tran: (液体、声音、气味)流出，发出，冒出
entry.def: When something such as a liquid, sound, or smell issues from something, it comes out of that thing.

example.ex: A tinny voice issued from a speaker.
example.tran: 扬声器里传出了细微的声音。

entry.def: The question or point at issue is the question or point that is being argued about or discussed.

example.ex: The problems of immigration were not the question at issue...
example.tran: 移民问题不在讨论之列。

example.ex: One of the main points at issue is that the Community wants the representatives to be based in East Jerusalem.
example.tran: 争论的要点之一是,共同体希望代表们的总部设在东耶路撒冷。

entry.tran: 使…引起关注;在…上挑起争论
entry.def: If you make an issue of something, you try to make other people think about it or discuss it, because you are concerned or annoyed about it.

example.ex: It seemed the Colonel had no desire to make an issue of the affair.
example.tran: 看上去上校不想在那件事上挑起争端。

entry.def: If you take issue with someone or something they said, you disagree with them, and start arguing about it.

example.ex: Sister Morrison might take issue with me on that matter...
example.tran: 莫里森修女在那件事上或许会和我持不同意见。

example.ex: I will not take issue with the fact that we have a recession.
example.tran: 我不否认经济衰退的事实。

entry.def: If someone has issues with a particular aspect of their life, they have problems connected with it.

example.ex: I think once you do have issues with food you're going to have them for the rest of your life.
example.tran: 我认为一旦你吃东西有问题的话,你可能终生都会如此。

means.word_mean: 1. an important question that is in dispute and must be settled;

sentences.sentence: "the issue could be settled by requiring public education for everyone"
"politicians never discuss the real issues"

means.word_mean: 2. one of a series published periodically;

sentences.sentence: "she found an old issue of the magazine in her dentist's waitingroom"

means.word_mean: 3. the provision of something by issuing it (usually in quantity);

sentences.sentence: "a new issue of stamps"
"the last issue of penicillin was over a month ago"

means.word_mean: 4. some situation or event that is thought about;

sentences.sentence: "he kept drifting off the topic"
"he had been thinking about the subject for several years"
"it is a matter for the police"

means.word_mean: 5. supplies (as food or clothing or ammunition) issued by the government
6. the immediate descendants of a person;

sentences.sentence: "she was the mother of many offspring"
"he died without issue"

means.word_mean: 7. a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon;

sentences.sentence: "the magnetic effect was greater when the rod was lengthwise"
"his decision had depressing consequences for business"
"he acted very wise after the event"

means.word_mean: 8. the income arising from land or other property;

sentences.sentence: "the average return was about 5%"

means.word_mean: 9. the becoming visible;

sentences.sentence: "not a day's difference between the emergence of the andrenas and the opening of the willow catkins"

means.word_mean: 10. an opening that permits escape or release;

sentences.sentence: "he blocked the way out"
"the canyon had only one issue"

means.word_mean: 11. the act of issuing printed materials
1. prepare and issue for public distribution or sale;

sentences.sentence: "publish a magazine or newspaper"

means.word_mean: 2. circulate or distribute or equip with;

sentences.sentence: "issue a new uniform to the children"
"supply blankets for the beds"

means.word_mean: 3. bring out an official document (such as a warrant)
4. come out of;

sentences.sentence: "Water issued from the hole in the wall"
"The words seemed to come out by themselves"

means.word_mean: 5. make out and issue;

sentences.sentence: "write out a check"
"cut a ticket"
"Please make the check out to me"

is行走+sue主题→走出主题→发行,发表

Sentence.sentence: I recommend Harvard's 2011 "Pathways to Prosperity" report for more attention to the "forgotten half" (those who do not go on to college) and ideas about how to address this issue.
The privacy issue has already landed Facebook in hot water in Washington.

As our special report in this issue (printed before Mr Jobs's death) explains, innovation used to spill over from military and corporate laboratories to the consumer market, but lately this process has gone into reverse.

sentences.en: There was no issue at all between us.

sentences.en: They advised the government not to issue him a passport to travel abroad.

sentences.en: Little money will issue from the bonds this year.

jushi.english: There is no issue at all of a happy.
jushi.chinese: 绝无可能获得圆满的结局。

jushi.english: A nosebleed is an issue of blood from the nose.
jushi.chinese: 鼻衄就是鼻孔流血的结果。

jushi.english: This has not been raised as an issue by the West.
jushi.chinese: 这点还没有被西方作为一个重要问题提出来。
